message.content: This question tests knowledge about the lunar phases. After the moon phase where you can see nothing of the moon, the next phase is the first quarter. During the first quarter, half of the moon is visible, resembling a half-moon shape. Option (A) is incorrect because the full moon is the phase where the entire moon is visible. Option (B) is incorrect because the last quarter comes after the full moon. Option (D) is incorrect because the half moon is another term for the first quarter.

This question requires knowledge about the different phases of the moon. After the moon phase where you see nothing of the moon (new moon), the next phase is the first quarter. During the first quarter, we can see half of the moon illuminated, hence the term "first quarter." Option (A) is incorrect because the full moon comes after the first quarter. Option (B) is incorrect because the last quarter comes after the full moon. Option (D) is incorrect because the half moon is not a specific phase of the moon.

This question requires knowledge about the phases of the moon. After the phase where you can see nothing of the moon, which is called the new moon, the next phase is the first quarter. During the first quarter, half of the moon's surface is illuminated, making it visible as a semi-circle (resembling a quarter of a full circle). Option (A) is incorrect because the full moon occurs when the entire face of the moon is illuminated. Option (B) is incorrect because the last quarter occurs after the third quarter. Option (D) is incorrect because the half moon is not a specific phase of the moon.

This question requires basic knowledge about the phases of the moon. After the moon phase when you can see nothing of the moon (called the New Moon), the next phase is the First Quarter. This is because the moon moves in a constant cycle where it becomes more visible (waxing) until it reaches the Full Moon phase, then it becomes less visible (waning) until it reaches the New Moon again. Option (A) is incorrect because it is the phase opposite the New Moon. Option (B) is halfway through the lunar cycle, but not the next phase after the New Moon. Option (D) is unclear, as the term "half moon" could refer to any of the moon's phases where exactly half of the moon is visible, including the First and Last Quarter.
